description.narrative: Minh Phu, Vietnam leading shrimp exporters who has been implementing eco-shrimp farming model in Ngoc hien District, Ca Mau Province with 1,271 households in mangrove forest. In the initial stage, Minh Phu successfully supported households to gain Naturland certificate for 871 households under the co-funding project by SNV/Oxfam and IUCN. That success has influenced Ca Mau government to issuethe pilot Pay-form Environmental Services(PES) on aquaculture (Decision 111/QD.UBND, dated 22/1/2016). Camau government has developed a provincial program on sustainable development of mangrove and shrimp for period of 2016-2020 and vision 2030 in which more than80,000 ha mangroves are proposed in Climate Change scenario, targeting to certified mangrove shrimp forenlarging, sustaining its supply chains. However, in order to scale up the pilot model in Camau, Minh Phu has faced many challenges regards to limited market access, various market quality certifications, financial investment for annual upgrade of production infrastructure, shared value commitment and capacity of farmers in compliance to quality certification. In response to those challenges, Minh Phu plans to develop social enterprise model for his mangrove shrimp supply chain in Ca Mau, in which the actors will together work for more shared value,strong linkage and cooperation for sustainable eco-shrimp of Vietnam. The shared value in the supply chain will help protect mangrove forest and enhance resilience, ensure sustainable livelihoods for farmers, sustain and extend export markets. Centre for Social Initiatives Promotion (CSIP) is a leading Vietnam-based, not-for-profit organization working to promote social and environmental changes by building a social entrepreneurship movement in Vietnam. Ittargets social enterprises, inclusive businesses, civil society organizations and other private/public institutions in Vietnam to support them with research, training, advice and networking to improve their knowledge and skills on social enterprising. CSIP also works and engages with other stakeholders to improve the enabling environment for social enterprises in general. CSIP is Oxfam#s partner in the SME Development Program for more than 2 years. As agreed under the collaboration for Minhphu SocialEnterprise model, Oxfam, Minh Phu and CSIP will conduct a research and a consultation workshop on the social landscape and potentiality of Social Enterprise /inclusive business for Minh Phu mangrove shrimp supply chain in Ngoc Hien district, Ca Mau province.

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
